mcq.statement: What power did the Rowlatt Act of 1919 grant to the British Indian government regarding suspected revolutionaries?

options.a: Imprison without trial for up to two years
options.c: Imprison with a trial for six months

mcq.one_liner: The Rowlatt Act of 1919 allowed the British Indian government to imprison any person suspected of terrorism or revolutionary activities for up to **two years without a trial**.
